intro: Microlicia barbata, commonly known as the hairy microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. Microlicia barbata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
